Topic.Title: One issue I have with windows 8

Message.Msg: I don't care how you set up your PC's, that's your business. I have a gaming key board & mouse connected to my gaming notebook pc and I can assure you my "set up" is many times more efficient than your touch screens. Touch screen is just another feature included in w8. I started out using w3.1 and I still can't tell you all the features a O/S has, the thing you do is set your pc up for the way you want to use it. GROW A BRAIN.

Topic.Title: Revealed: how Microsoft handed the NSA access to encrypted messages

Message.Msg: When the infamous Stuxnet virus was revealed those that discovered it said the comparatively huge multi-purpose spyware package went undetected for so long because the code carried an authentic Microsoft signature, the type used for Microsoft's own software updates. This could have only happened one of two ways; either the author was able to distort the principles of mathematics and hash algorithms to masquerade as Microsoft at will ( a virtually impossible task), or the author simply used Microsoft's digital certificates to sign their code. I think that mystery is now solved. Either way, it does not inspire confidence in the software supply chain.

Topic.Title: S&P Downgrades to sell

Message.Msg: • S&P LOWERS OPINION ON SHARES OF MICROSOFT (MSFT 36 **) TO SELL FROM HOLD: We lower our 12-month target price by $6, to $30, based on a discounted peer group P/E multiple. We believe a discount is warranted due to the continued decline in personal computer unit sales and MSFT's just announced restructuring. We think the restructuring to focus on devices and services is overdue and where the computing market is today, and therefore view it as a needed move by MSFT. Our concern, however, is that it will take time for the restructuring to take hold and bear fruit. So while needed, we see the realignment adding execution risk to revenues and earnings./B. Coffey

Message.Title: Ballmer and "truthiness"
Message.Msg: I don't believe this asusming he said it (apparently to a Seattle reporter), hard to image he would even say it. If he did he just his credibility as far as believeing anything he says. "For now, Microsoft employees can rest easy. As part of a media and analyst conference call today, Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer told a reporter from the Seattle Times."We have no plans for layoffs". He added, "We certainly want to extend what we’re doing.” That would seem to suggest that Microsoft could in fact be hiring more people; a report in late-May suggested that Microsoft was planning to hire thousands of new workers to boost Windows Phone and its cloud platforms in China."

Topic.Title: Ballmer and "truthiness"

Message.Msg: Quoting from Wikipedia: "Truthiness is a quality characterizing a "truth" that a person making an argument or assertion claims to know intuitively "from the gut" or because it "feels right" without regard to evidence, logic, intellectual examination, or facts.[1] "American television comedian Stephen Colbert coined the word in this meaning[2] as the subject of a segment called "The Wørd" during the pilot episode of his political satire program The Colbert Report on October 17, 2005. By using this as part of his routine, Colbert satirized the misuse of appeal to emotion and "gut feeling" as a rhetorical device in contemporaneous socio-political discourse.[3]"

Topic.Title: Aiming for “Functional Coherence,” Mulling a Different P&L and With Advice From Ford CEO, Microsoft Restructuring Set for Thursday

Message.Msg: Have to agree. Microsoft, even at its best, no longer lives in the same world. The public is no longer quite so naive about computing. Linux is mature and now well known to the public, though by several different names. Chrome OS is now a serious threat to Microsoft's core business, i.e. enterprise IT. Mobile and even wearable computing is the future, and Microsoft, even at its best, has no standing in that game and has to fight its own reputation for arrogant ineptitude.

No, dead wrong, I have a gun with me most times as I have for 20 years and I have not so much as let anyone know I have it, You logic is stupid, you hatred of whites is telling your desire to convict with no evidence shows you un-American. If he did he would have had gun in hand and not gotten his nose broken and his head smashed into the concrete sidewalk, both of which we know factually happened.
